        public static void GenerateThumbnailInDir(java.lang.Object inFile,
                                          java.io.File outFile,
                                          float seconds,
                                          int w,
                                          int h)
        Generates a mediafile video thumbnail.
        Parameters:
        inFile - Sage MediaFile or IMediaFile
        outFile - destination filepath and name
        seconds - seconds offset
        w - width
        h - height
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the image was not created

      • GenerateThumbnail

        public static void GenerateThumbnail(java.lang.Object inFile,
                                     float seconds,
                                     int w,
                                     int h)
        Generates a mediafile thumbnail to the default video thumbnail dir for the file. The file name is like "Sseconds_WIDTH_HEIGHT.jpg, ie, S60000.0_320_200.jpg
        Parameters:
        inFile -
        seconds -
        w -
        h -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • GenerateThumbnailsEvenly

        public static java.io.File[] GenerateThumbnailsEvenly(java.lang.Object file,
                                                      int thumbs,
                                                      int w,
                                                      int h)
        Generates n number of thumbs throughout a given mediafile, where each thumb is evenly spaced throughout the file.

        All files will be removed from the outdir before the batch is created. If outdir is null, then outdir will default to the default thumbnail dir

        Parameters:
        file -
        thumbs - total number of thumbs that will be created
        w -
        h -

      • GetThumbnailDetails

        public static java.lang.String[] GetThumbnailDetails(java.io.File f)
        Retuns an array of image details. The first element is the seconds, followed by the width, and then the height.

        A null array is returned if the info cannot be determined.

        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:
